intro: Neckia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed neckia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its obovate, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It is often found in shaded, moist environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
